channel.title: Npc's
channel.description:
Ive Just Added Som More Npc's To My Server, And Now When I Spawn A Npc And Attack It, My Client Freezes
But When I Attack A Npc A Npc That I Didnt Spawn It Doesnt Freeze.
It Also Freezes When I Attack The Second Spawn Of Kq..Because It Spawns From The First one...
So Does AnyOne Know How I Can Fix This?With Out Deleteing Any Npc?

I Have Been Ive Tried With Men id = 1 and Ive tried High lvls As Well

That Still Freezes, I Think I Have To Change The Max Ammount Of Npc’s Or Something But Ive Tried Makeing The Number Bigger For Max Npc’s In Npc Handler And That Didnt Work.

Is There Any Other Max Npc’s Anywhere TYhat I Should Change Or SOmething?

item.title: Npc's
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Try my simplier command i made lol

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("npc") && playerRights > 2){ int newnpc = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4)); server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(newnpc, absX, absY); sM("You spawn npc # "+newnpc+"."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's
item.dc:creator: @mrx229 mrx229
item.description:
@mrx229 wrote:

hmmm…well heres my spawnANPC
public void spawnANPC(int npcID, int absX, int absY)
{

	server.npcHandler.newNPC(npcID, (absX), (absY), 0, absX + 3, absY + 3, absX - 3, absY - 3, 1, server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(npcID), false);
}

I Dont Think Theres Anything Wrong With That…

And Heres My Npc Command

if (command.startsWith("npc") && playerRights >= 3) {
{

BufferedWriter bw = null;
try {
int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4));
if (newNPC >= 0)
{
server.npcHandler.newNPC(newNPC, absX, (absY + 1), heightLevel, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, false);
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“data/writed/npcs.txt”, true));
bw.write(“spawn = “+newNPC);
bw.write(” “+absX);
bw.write(” “+absY);
bw.write(” 0 0681 9546 2677 9542 2 newnpc”);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
sendMessage(“You spawn an npc”);
NpcMapper(newNPC);
sendMessage(“You spawn an npc”);
NpcMapper(newNPC);
}
else
{
sendMessage(“No such NPC.”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Wrong Syntax! Use as ::npc 1”);
}
}
}

Read full topic
